intro: Jasione montana subsp. montana, commonly known as mountain jasione, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, clustered flowers and lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in late spring to early summer. Jasione montana subsp. montana is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance.
